desc: Explore the breathtaking landscape of the Grand Canyon as you listen to the calming sounds of nature.

sttData.content: The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River in the state of Arizona.
The canyon is over 277 miles long, up to 18 miles wide, and over a mile deep.
The Grand Canyon has become a major tourist attraction and is a National Park.
Some parts of the canyon are considered sacred in various Native American cultures and are preserved as such.
The Grand Canyon is a unique and majestic landscape that offers visitors an unforgettable experience.

stt.sttSummary: The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River in Arizona, over 277 miles long, up to 18 miles wide, and over a mile deep. It is a major tourist attraction and a National Park. Some parts of the canyon are considered sacred in various Native American cultures and are preserved as such. The Grand Canyon offers visitors an unforgettable experience.
